description: '''Vladimir Semyonovich Vysotsky'''{{efn|{{langx|ru|links=no|Владимир Семёнович Высоцкий|Vladimir Semyonovich Vysotsky}}, {{IPA|ru|vlɐˈdʲimʲɪr sʲɪˈmʲɵnəvʲɪtɕ vɨˈsotskʲɪj}}}}{{family name footnote|Semyonovich|Vysotsky|lang=Eastern Slavic}} (25 January 1938{{snd}}25 July 1980) was a Soviet singer-songwriter, poet, and actor who had an immense and enduring effect on [[Culture of the Soviet Union|Soviet culture]]. He became widely known for his unique singing style and for his lyrics, which featured social and political commentary in often-humorous street jargon. He was also a prominent stage- and screen-actor. Though the official Soviet cultural establishment largely ignored his work, he was remarkably popular during his lifetime and has exerted significant influence on many of Russia's musicians and actors.
